Citations.Cited_Guidance: If a geographic scope type is global then no code is expected to specify the specific area within scope while if it is not global then a code is expected to specify the specific area within scope.

rule.Check:
**[instanceType="GeographicScope" and (type.code="C68846")=($exists(code) and code)].
  {
    "instanceType": instanceType,
    "id": id,
    "path": _path,
    "type.code": type.code,
    "type.decode": type.decode,
    "code.standardCode.code": code.standardCode.code,
    "code.standardCode.decode": code.standardCode.decode
  }
rule.Description: If a geographic scope type is global then no code is expected to specify the specific area within scope while if it is not global then a code is expected to specify the specific area within scope.

Outcome.Message: The geographic scope is global (type.code = C68846) and a code has been specified for the specific area or the geographic scope is not global (type.code is not C68846) and no code has been specified for the specific area.
